question: Who was only seen at rare intervals, once in every seven years or so?
answer1: an Elfin Knight

question: Why was everyone afraid of the Elfin Knight?
answer1: Someone would set out to cross the moor and would never be heard of again.

question: What did the men do after someone disappeared from the moor?
answer1: search every inch of the ground

question: Why was the moor deserted?
answer1: Nobody dare pass that way, much less live there.

question: Why did wild animals live in the moor?
answer1: They found that they never were disturbed by mortal huntsmen.

question: Who were such friends that they rode, and hunted, and fought together?
answer1: Earl St. Clair and Earl Gregory

question: Why did Earl Gregory suggested one day that they should go a-hunting on the haunted moor?
answer1: They were both very fond of the chase.

question: Why didn't Earl Gregory believe in the Elfin Knight?
answer1: He thought it's an old wife's tale to frighten children.

question: Why didn't Earl St. Clair agree with Earl Gregory about the Elfin Knight?
answer1: He knew travelers would disappear after crossing the moor.
answer2: He believed the Elfin Knight chose to claim the land as him.

question: What did Earl St. Clair want to put on their wrists?
answer1: the Sign of the Blessed Trinity

question: Why did Earl St. Clair want to wear the Sign of the Blessed Trinity on his wrists?
answer1: He heard that a person is safe from the Elfin Knight if they wear the Sign of the Blessed Trinity.
answer2: He heard that they needed to wear the Sign of the Blessed Trinity to protect themselves from the Elfin Knight.

question: What did Sir Gregory plan to use to protect himself from the Elfin Knight?
answer1: his good bow and arrow

question: Why didn't Earl St. Clair heed his companion's words?
answer1: His mother told him that the Sign of the Blessed Trinity would protect him from any spell
answer2: His mother told him that the Sign of the Blessed Trinity would help him.

question: What did Earl St. Clair do before they rode to the moor?
answer1: went out to the meadow and plucked a leaf of clover, which he bound on his arm with a silken scarf

question: Why did the young men forget their fears of the Elfin Knight?
answer1: It went well for a few hours.
answer2: They did not have any issues for awhile.

question: How did the young men feel after they saw a horseman?
answer1: scared
answer2: afraid

question: What did Sir Gregory plan to do after they saw the horseman?
answer1: follow him
answer2: follow the horseman

question: What did Earl St. Clair see the horseman doing?
answer1: fly through the air

question: Why couldn't  Sir Gregory see the same thing as Earl St. Clair?
answer1: Earl St. Clair wore the Sign of the Blessed Trinity.
answer2: Sir Gregory did not wear the Sign of the Blessed Trinity.

question: How was Earl St. Clair able to see what the horseman was doing?
answer1: He carried a Talisman which his companion lacked, that enabled him to see things as they really were.

question: How will Earl St. Clair feel after Sir Gregory does not see the same thing as him?
answer1: startled
answer2: amazed

question: What did Sir Gregory do after he decided to follow the horseman?
answer1: put spurs to his horse and galloped off in the direction which the mysterious stranger had taken

question: What did Earl St. Clair do after his companion left him?
answer1: touched the sacred Sign and his trembling lips muttered prayers for protection

question: Why did Earl St. Clair mutter prayers for protection?
answer1: He knew that his friend had been bewitched.

question: How did Earl St. Clair feel after his companion left him?
answer1: concerned
answer2: worried

question: What did Earl St. Clair decide to do after he finished muttering prayers?
answer1: follow him to the world's end, if need be, and try to deliver him from the spell that had been cast over him

question: Where did Earl Gregory follow the horseman to?
answer1: the most desolate region

question: What did Earl Gregory see on the ground?
answer1: an enormous Ring

question: What will happen after Earl Gregory follows the horseman?
answer1: He will meet Goblins.
answer2: He will see Goblins.

question: What were the weird Goblins doing?
answer1: shouting and singing as they danced, and waving their arms above their heads, and throwing themselves about on the ground

question: What did the weird Goblins do after they saw Earl Gregory?
answer1: beckoned to him with their skinny fingers

question: Why did Earl Gregory obeyed the eldrich summons?
answer1: There was a spell casted over him.
answer2: A spell was casted on him.

question: How did Earl Gregory feel when he saw the weird Goblins?
answer1: scared
answer2: afraid

question: Who stepped out from among his companions and approached him?
answer1: an old and grizzled Goblin

question: What did the old and grizzled Goblin do to talk to Earl Gregory?
answer1: stopped at the edge of it; then, stooping down and pretending to pick up something, he whispered in a hoarse whisper

question: Why did the old and grizzled Goblin talk to Earl Gregory?
answer1: He was warning him to leave.
answer2: He was warning him to not step into the Ring.

question: Why didn't Earl Gregory listen to the old and grizzled Goblin's warning?
answer1: He made a vow.
answer2: He wanted to carry out his vow.

question: What did Earl Gregory do after he ignored the old and grizzled Goblin's words?
answer1: stepped over the edge of the Circle

question: What did the goblins do as Early Gregory started to walk into the Circle?
answer1: shouted louder than ever, and danced more madly, and sang more lustily

question: What did the goblins do after there was a silence?
answer1: parted into two companies, leaving a way through their midst, up which they signed to the Earl to pass

question: What did the Knight do after he saw Earl Gregory?
answer1: lifted it from the table, and handed it to him with a stately bow

question: What happened after Earl Gregory came to the middle of the Circle?
answer1: The Knight seated at a table of red marble.
answer2: The Knight sat at a table of red marble.

question: What did Earl Gregory notice while he was drinking the ale?
answer1: The ale in the goblet never grew less.

question: How did Earl Gregory feel while he was drinking the ale?
answer1: concerned
answer2: worried

question: What will happen after earl Gregory drinks the ale?
answer1: He will fall down.

question: Why did the goblins convince Earl Gregory to get into their Ring and throw their spell over him?
answer1: They wanted him to spend many years with them.
answer2: They wanted him to spend long years in their company.

question: How did the goblins feel after Earl Gregory drank the ale and fell to the ground?
answer1: happy
answer2: joyful

question: How did the goblins feel after they heard another human approaching?
answer1: scared
answer2: afraid

question: What did the goblins hear that filled their hearts with dread?
answer1: the sound of human footsteps

question: Why did the goblins' shouts of triumphs begin to die away?
answer1: Their keen ears heard a sound which filled their hearts with dread.

question: How did the goblins know the stranger was untouched by any charm?
answer1: The human footsteps were so free and untrammelled.

question: Why were the goblins worried about the stranger?
answer1: He might work them ill, and rescue their captive from them.

question: Who approached, fearless and strong because of the Holy Sign he bore?
answer1: Earl St. Clair

question: What did Earl St. Clair see, while he searched for Earl Gregory?
answer1: the charmed Ring and the eldrich dancers

question: What did the little grizzled Goblin do when Earl St. Clair was about to step over the magic border?
answer1: came and whispered to him

question: Why did the little grizzled Goblin try to warn Earl St. Clair?
answer1: The grizzled goblin did not want him to have the same faith as his companion.
answer2: The grizzled Goblin wanted to save him from the Elfin Knight.

question: Why was the grizzled Goblin doomed to bide there for seven long years?
answer1: followed the Elfin Knight here, and drank his heather ale

question: What did Earl St. Clair need to do first to save his companion?
answer1: remain motionless in the cold and frost till dawn break and the hour come

question: Why did Earl St. Clair need to save his companion from the Elfin Knight?
answer1: His companion would turn into a goblin.
answer2: His companion would need to serve the Elfin Knight for seven years.

question: Why didn't Earl St. Clair fear the Elfin Knight's spell?
answer1: He bore the Sign of One Who was stronger than he.

question: What did Earl St. Clair need to do after he remained motionless?
answer1: walk slowly nine times round the edge of the enchanted Circle

question: What did Earl St. Clair need to do after he walked slowly nine times?
answer1: walk boldly across it to the red marble table where sits the Elfin King

question: What did Earl St. Clair need to take from the red marble table?
answer1: an emerald goblet

question: Why couldn't Earl St. Clair utter a word while his feet were on the enchanted ground?
answer1: If he uttered a word, he would fall through the bog and die.
answer2: If he uttered a word, he would fall into the bog with the monster.

question: What did Earl St. Clair do after he heard  the sound of the Matin Bell?
answer1: began his solemn walk

question: Why wasn't Earl St. Clair hurt after the ground shook?
answer1: He had the power of the Blessed Sign on his arm.
answer2: He had the protection from the Blessed Sign on his arm.

question: How did Earl St. Clair feel after he saw the frozen Elves and Goblins?
answer1: surprised
answer2: astonished

question: What did Earl St. Clair see after he finished pacing round the Ring?
answer1: all the ghostly Elves and Goblins whom he had seen, were lying frozen into tiny blocks of ice

question: Why was the Elfin King sitting stiff and stark like his followers?
answer1: He was frozen too.
answer2: The cold froze him.

question: Who were guarding the emerald goblet?
answer1: two coal-black ravens

question: What did the ravens do after Earl St. Clair lifted the precious cup?
answer1: rose in the air and circled round his head, screaming with rage, and threatening to dash it from his hands with their claws

question: What did the Elves and their King do after Earl St. Clair lifted the precious cup?
answer1: stirred in their sleep, and half sat up

question: Why didn't the Elves and their Kings attack Earl St. Clair?
answer1: The Power of the Holy Sign restrained them.

question: Who was lurking in the hidden lake, eager for prey?
answer1: the awful Monster

question: What did Earl St. Clair hear after he retraced his steps?
answer1: shrieks from the ravens, screams of the Goblins, and the deep breaking of the awful Monster
answer2: sounds of the ravens, Goblins, and the awful Monster

question: Why wasn't Earl St. Clair afraid of the sounds he heard?
answer1: He trusted in the Might of the Sign he bore.

question: What did Earl St. Clair do after he stepped on solid ground once more?
answer1: flung the enchanted goblet from him

question: What happened to the Elves and their King after Earl St. Clair flung the enchanted goblet from him?
answer1: Every one of the frozen Elves vanished, along with their King and his marble table.

question: What happened to Earl Gregory after Earl St. Clair flung the enchanted goblet from him?
answer1: Earl Gregory  slowly woke from his enchanted slumber.

question: What did Earl St. Clair and Earl Gregory find after they returned to the spot where he threw the goblet?
answer1: nothing but a piece of rough grey whinstone, with a drop of dew hidden in a little crevice

question: Why did Earl St. Clair hold Earl Gregory in his arms?
answer1: Earl St. Clair was trying to warm him up.
answer2: Earl St. Clair was making sure he was ok.
